Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Bowl with decoration
Description: This bowl of red terracotta, which dates from the beginning of the second century of our era, bears a black coloured decoration representing  bunches of grapes. The piece, which has been found in a tomb at Faras, is part of a specific type of bowl used in different areas at the end of the Meroitic Period.
